bibl.title: Salfest A. Sylvester v. Stener S. Wennaas. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, Northern Division.
div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Salfest A. Sylvester for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
div1.ab: No. PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
div1.p: To the Honorable C. H. Hanford, Judge of the above entitled Court:
Comes now the petitioner, Salfest A. Sylvester, a citizen of the United States and a resident of the State of Washington, and respectfully represents to the court as follows:

That he is now confined as a prisoner in the county jail of King County, State of Washington, and that to the best of his knowledge he is not committed or detained by virtue of any process of law known to the courts of the United States, or of the several States, but that he is so detaied and restrained of his liberty in violation of the Constitution and of the laws of said government, and in violation of the Constitution and laws of the State of Washington, and that he is not held in confinement by virtue of any final judgment or decree of any competent court or tribunal or constituted authority, or by virtue of any process issued upon any valid judgment, decree or warrant, and that he is so held without due process of law.
That the facts concerning his detention as aforesaid and the claim of authority by virtue of which he is so restrained of his liberty are, to the best of his knowledge and belief, as follows:

That on or about the 26th day of December, 1898, your petitioner was taken in custody by one Stener S. Wennaas, claiming to be an agent appointed by the Governor of the State of North Dakota for the purpose of siizing your petitioner as a fugitive from the justice of said State of North Dakota under a demand made, as he alleges, by the Governor of the State of North Dakota upon the Governor of the State of Washington for the extradition of your petitioner from his said

present place of residence to said State of North Dakota, that said Stener S. Wennass further claimed at that time, and still claims, to be entitled to the custody of your petitioner for the purpose of extraditing him as aforesaid under and by virtue of a pretended warrant issued by the Governor of the State of Washington, of which the following is a copy: of which the following is
div1.ab: UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. STATE OF WASHINGTON. EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT.
div1.p: To all to whom these presents shall come, greeting:

WHEREAS, it has been represented to the by His Excellency Joseph M. Davine, Governor of the State of North Dakota, the Salfest A. Sylvester stands charged in said State with the crime of embezzlement committed in the County of Traill in said State, and is a fugitive from the justice of said State, and has taken refuge in the State of Washington;

AND WHEREAS, the said Governor of the State of North Dakota has pursuant to the Constitution and laws of the United States demanded of me that I cause the said Salfest A. Sylvester to be arrested and delivered to Stener S. Wenass, agents authorized to receive him into their custody and convey him back to said State of North Dakota;

AND WHEREAS, said representation and demand are accompanied by affidavits, complaint, informatin, indictment and warrant whereby the said Salfest A. Sylvester is charged with the said crime, and being a fugitive from the justice of the said State and having taken refuge in the State of Washington, which are certified by said Governor of North Dakota to be duly authenticated.

NOW THEREFORE, I J. R. Rogers, Governor of the State of Washington, do hereby authorize and empower Stener S. Wenaas, the agent named in said demand, to take the said Salfest A. Sylvester wherever he may be found in this State, and transfer him to the line thereof at the expense of the State of North Dakota.
And I hereby command all civil officers within said State of Washington to afford all needful assistance for the execution of this warrant.
IN TESTIMONY WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand and caused the seal of the said State of Washington to be fixed at Olympia, this twenty-sixth day of December, A.D. 1898.
div1.ab: J. R. ROGERS.
By the Governor, WILL D. JENKINS, Secretary of State.
By H. ALLING, Chief Clerk
div1.p: That acting under said pretended warrant and in his capacity as such pretended agent, the said Stener S. Wannaas, placed your petitioner in the county jail of said King County, Washington, in the temporary custody of the sheriff of said county, who was then one William H. Moyer, pending the proposed removal of your petitioner to the said State of North Dakota.

That the said Sterner S. Wennaas is now in the City of Seattle, in said King County, State of Washington for the purpose of forceably removing your petitioner against his will from the State of Washington to the State of North Dakota, and that he will do so forthwith unless restrained by the order of this court, and that your petitioner is now being held by A. T. Vandeventer, who is now the sheriff of said King County, State of Washington, in response to the demand of said pretended agent, who is agent of the said Sterner S. Wennaas. and who is the agent of said Sterner S. Wennaas
That your petitioner has never had a valid determination of his rights in said matter by the courts of the State of Washington.

That your petitioner is so held in custody in violation of the Constitution and laws of the United States and without legal process, for the reason that he is held under a claim arising out of the Constitution of the United States and th extradition laws thereof, and that the provisions of said Constitution and laws have been violated and disregarded in the following respects:

1. Because the Governor of the State of North Dakota in his alleged demand upon the Governor of the State of Washington did not accompany the same with documents suc as required by the extradition laws of the United States, and because it does not appear from said demand and the documents accompanying the same that your petitioner stands charged before any court of the State of North Dakota with the commission of any crime against the laws of said State, and because it does not appear therefrom that your petitioner is a fugitive from the justice of said State.
2. Because your petitioner is not a fugitive from the justice of said State, and because he is not guilty of any crime against said law
3. Because the said extradition warrant to issued by the Governor of the State of Washington does not state facts sufficient to warrant the arrest and detention of your petitioner.
4. Because said warrant is void on its face for the following reasons:
(a) It does not appear therefrom that your petitioner was actually present in the State of North Dakota when the alleged embezzlement referred to in said warrant was committed.

(b) Because it does not appear from said warrant that your petitioner stands charged with treason, felony, or any other crime, in that, it does not appear from said warrant that there is any statute in the State of North Dakota defining embezzlement and making it a criminal offense, and because no proof was submitted to the Governor of the State of Washington of the existence of any such law.
(c) Because said warrant does not state facts sufficient to constitute any act of embezzelment or any other crime, either under the laws of the State of Washington, or the State of North Dakota.

(d) Because said warrant recits that the representations and demand of the Governor of the STate of North Dakota were accompanied by "affidavits, complaint, information and indictment," and it does not appear therefrom what was the particular form of accusation upon which the Governor of the State of Washington issued his warrant, and because it does not appear therefrom that said Governor issued his warrant upon affidavit, complaint or information made before a magistrate of the State of North Dakota.
5. That your petitioner is not guilty of the alleged offense of embezzelment.

WHEREFORE, to be relieved of said unlawful detention and imprisonment, your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue directed to the said Sterner S. Wennaas and A. T. Van devanter, may issue in this behalf, so that your petitioner may be forthwith brought before this court to do, submit to and receive waht the law may require.
div1.ab: S A Sylvester PETITIONER.
R B Albertson Atty for Petitioner
United States of America, State of Washington, County of King.
ss.
div1.p: Salfest A. Sylvester, being first duly sworn, on his oath deposes and says: That he is the petitioner named in the above and foregoing petition; that he has read the same, knows the contents thereof, and that the statements therein made are true, as he verily believes.
div1.ab: S A Sylvester
div1.p: Subscribed and sworn to before me this 26th day of June, A. D. 1899.
div1.ab: James B Murphey
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
Tx
In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES District of Washingtion, Northern Division
In the Matter of the Application of Salfest A. Sylvester for a writ of habeas corpus
Petition for H C Writ Order to Show Cause

Filed this 26th day of June 1899
A. Reeves Ayres Clerk. By HM Matthew Deputy
Jas. Hamilton Lewis,R B Albertson Attorney for Petitioner
Office-FIFTH FLOOR, PIONEER BLOCK Corner First Act. and James St. SEATTLE, WASH.
